adjectives.description: spatulate (comparative more spatulate, superlative most spatulate)

entries.meaning: Shaped like a spatula; having a rounded, flattened extremity.
(botany) Of a leaf: having a broad, flat end and tapering into a narrower base.

verbs.description: spatulate (third-person singular simple present spatulates, present participle spatulating, simple past and past participle spatulated)

entries.meaning: To treat or mix with a spatula.
To incise the end of a pliable cylindrical structure such that the cut end can be splayed apart and flattened
